::Battera:;

She jerked her hand away as he frowned at her.  She didn't want to 
upset him any further.  She could see the pain in his eyes as if he 
was seeing his friends death all over again.
"I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to upset you. I never meant to..I mean..I 
wasn't intending to bother you about.....oh, I meant I.." she was 
tripping over her own tongue.
"Your fine. I mean that as far as company, your really nice." She 
smiled a nervouse smile.  Really, she was feeling embarresed.  She 
wanted to say something to try to help Rex, but she only ended up 
tripping over her own words.
"I'm sorry. Really, I'm sorry about your friends. If you want to talk 
about it, I'm willing to listen." 
She could have slapped herself for that. Oh, now he thinks I'm an 
idiotic, can't even talk type bat, she thought.

She turned to walk with him and she tripped.  She fell right on top 
of him.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Rex::
> 
> Rex frowns as Battera puts her hand on his shoulder, the Maximal 
stopping. He 
> looks at her, and then shifts his eyes back ahead of him. His 
optics were 
> sad, the painful memories awakened in his mind.
> 
> "I probably should have sent Firearm to escort you. He's much 
better company 
> than me," he resumes walking, wondering if the trigger happy 
Maximal 
> (Firearm) would have opened fire on Battera as soon as he saw her.
